meanings.definition: Turned into bone or bony tissue.
meanings.sent1: The ossified skeleton of the dinosaur was carefully studied by scientists.
meanings.sent2: The ossified remains of ancient creatures provide valuable insights into prehistoric life.
meanings.sent3: The ossified bones of the museum's exhibit seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent4: Her ossified beliefs were as unyielding as the stone walls surrounding her.
meanings.sent5: The ossified tree stood tall and proud, a testament to its enduring strength.

meanings.definition: Hardened or rigidified in structure or habits.
meanings.sent1: The ossified bread left on the counter was no longer edible.
meanings.sent2: His ossified mindset prevented him from considering new ideas.
meanings.sent3: The ossified routine of the old clockmaker amused his grandchildren.
meanings.sent4: The ossified traditions of the village were like ancient roots, deeply entrenched.
meanings.sent5: The ossified clay statue stood firm against the test of time, unmoved by the elements.

meanings.definition: To become rigid or inflexible in habits, attitudes, opinions, etc.
meanings.sent1: Over time, he ossified in his ways and refused to adapt to modern technology.
meanings.sent2: The company's policies ossified, hindering progress and innovation.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said her dad had ossified into a grumpy old bear.
meanings.sent4: His heart ossified with bitterness, closing off any chance of reconciliation.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant community ossified into a ghost town, frozen in time.
